recipe: Cover the fish in half the fajita mix. You may also want to season it and add a little oil.
Bake at around 200c for 15-20 mins until the fish is flakey.
In the meantime, cut up the peppers, onions and whatever other veg you have available. Stirfry the veg in a little oil and the rest of the fajita mix.
Warm the wraps in the microwave.
When everything is cooked, add the fish and veg to the wraps and add creme fraiche, salsa, cheese or guacamole as preferred.
Cut up the onions and chicken and brown off in a pan.
Cut up the peppers and whatever other veg you have available and add them to the pan with the fajita mix and a little oil. Keep stirring to cover the chicken and veg in the fajita mix.
Warm the wraps in the microwave.
When everything is cooked, add the chicken and veg to the wraps and add creme fraiche, salsa, cheese or guacamole as preferred.
Cut up the onions and halloumi and brown off in a pan.
Cut up the peppers and whatever other veg you have available and add them to the pan with the fajita mix and a little oil. Keep stirring to cover the halloumi and veg in the fajita mix.
Warm the wraps in the microwave.
When everything is cooked, add the halloumi and veg to the wraps and add creme fraiche, salsa, cheese or guacamole as preferred.
Cut up the onions and halloumi and brown off in a pan.
Cut and peel the sweet potato and/or potatoes, and boil them with a little salt.
When onions, halloumi and potatoes are ready, add them all to a big pan with the tinned tomatoes.
Add a tablespoon of curry powder. You can also add paprika, pepper, salt or whatever flavouring you like. Remember to taste as you go.
When you are happy with the flavour, add the coconut milk.
Cut up the peppers and whatever other veg you have available. Chickpeas work well. Add them to the pan and leave to simmer.
When ready, serve with rice or flat bread. Tastes even better as leftovers.
Cut up the onions and brown off in a pan.
Cut and peel the sweet potato and/or potatoes, and boil them with a little salt.
When onions and potatoes are ready, add them to a big pan with the tinned tomatoes and chickpeas.
Add a tablespoon of curry powder. You can also add paprika, pepper, salt or whatever flavouring you like. Remember to taste as you go.
When you are happy with the flavour, serve on its own or with rice, cheese and/or creme fraiche.
Cover wrap with pasata sauce using the back of a tea spoon. If you like, you can also season with salt, pepper or herbs.
Cut up the onions, peppers or whatever else you fancy for your pizetta. Place them on the pizetta and then cover with cheese.
Bake in the oven at 180c for about 10 minutes or until the cheese bubbles.
